intro: Strophostyles pauciflora var. canescens, commonly known as the woolly strophostyle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
